Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from three fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior wholly glazed; around rim, band of dots between pairs of lines in added; below, band of lotus buds in white outline and added red centres above three white lines; around lost omphalos, band of tongues alternating red and white; exterior: wide black band around rim above single line; four lines on reserved wall.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the decoration, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA96. The sherd is also published in Bergeron, M. forthcoming, ‘Pots and People: Greek trade and votive rituals at Naukratis’, in L. Hulin (ed.), Heracleion in Context: The Maritime Economy of the Egyptian Late Period, Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 301, no. 1073)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 50, pl. V, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1988) (phase 2)
